channel.title: A question
channel.description: I'm new to Minecraft, and I wanted to ask a few things, because I'm not so sure about what to do. Sorry if these questions have been asked before. What type of mode should I play on, Paid Beta, or free Classic? Is there more than one server in Minecraft? How is a server made? I'm not even sure about how to play the game.

item.title: A question
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Qazz:

What’s a cracked client? (Sorry if I sound dumb) And isn’t survival mode in paid Beta?

A cracked client for minecraft (for example, myn that krackkid posted) will let you login to the game without paying for it, using any name you wish. Within this, getting each update that normally only paid players get.

Using my cracked client and not buying the game only leaves 2 things you dont get that paid players do. The online server u want to play needs online-mode set to false otherwise u will be kicked. As well as the fact you cannot change your skin.

Read full topic

item.title: A question
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

 The server here is beta, you can use a cracked client however you won't be able to choose your own in-game skin.  Yes there's more than one server for minecraft this is just one of a thousand.   The servers useally are not made by people but can download the server from the Minecraft from [url=http://www.minecraft.net/]http://www.minecraft.net/[/url] however there are a few third party servers.  You can also download plugins for the server from the Minecraft forums website.  As for the mode mostly everyone here is doing [url=http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Survival_(Game_Mode)]http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Survival_(Game_Mode)[/url]. The game also features single-player.

Read full topic
